page.title: 03FEATURES OF CHIGWELL
page.content: Chigwell is residential, extending along the high land on the east side of Roding Valley. Although there are modern housing estates and shops you can still see a number of old buildings. It still has the village atmosphere the led Charles Dickens to say"Such an out of the way rural place". the kings head a fine 17th century inn still has a part of it called "Dickens Hall". Chigwell Church has doubled in size since 1886,& it has some original Norman work. Chigwell Private School dates from the 18th century. Other buildings include Chigwell Hall, the former manor house and is now used by the Metropolitan Police. Further north is a 17th century Turnows Hall and Woolston Hall,which is now a night club.
